result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominick Thomas King

records.addlTxt:
2:43 PM Defendant Dominick Thomas King appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
Court questions the defendant if he wishes to have counsel represent him.
Defendant responds.
Court questions Atty Taylor Soule if someone has completed and evaluation on the defendant.
She does not know but does state that he can call the public defender's office and they can evaluate him over the phone.
State public defender has made multiple contacts for attorney appointment.
Defendant is in custody as he is being revoked.
Defendant will be sent back to the Manitowoc County Jail as he was brought over on an Order to Produce.
Public defender's office is aware that he is awaiting counsel.

BY THE COURT: 
Adjourned Initial Appearance set and defendant allowed to appear via ZOOM.
ADA Pfeil does not object to setting bond at the next hearing once he has counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report filed by Atty Kate Frigo Drury
Order to Produce filed by the State (sent to Br 2 Judge on 10/12/22 sp)

1:51 PM Defendant Dominick Thomas King appeared by video, in custody from the Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.

Defendant is not aware of the criminal complaint that has been filed against him.
Defendant will be incarcerated until at least Christmas.
ADA Dodge to mail a copy of the criminal complaint to the Manitowoc County Jail.
ADA Dodge states that a copy of the complaint had been mailed to the Manitowoc County Jail on 09/09/22.
Defendant is informed of his right to be represented by an attorney.
Court questions the defendant if he has been in contact with the State Public Defender's Office.  
Defendant responds.
Court questions the defendant with regards to making a personal appearance.
Defendant wishes to be brought back for the adjourned initial appearance.
State would request bond be set at the next hearing.
State is in compliance with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT: 
Initial Appearance to be adjourned.
Defendant to follow up with the public defender's office.
Branch 3 Judicial Assistant will contact the public defender's office to follow up.
State is to complete an order to produce.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 10/10/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 3
